For people
who want to participate

content: https://github.com/eth-protocol-fellows/cohort-five/blob/main/program-guide/participation-guide.md

author: advaitasaha
content:
Your contributions should be towards the protocol development 
So I don't think contribution to the wiki will count

author: arredr2
content: Along with what <@706747269424218124> said, you can use the EPF wiki as a learning resource and a way to flesh out your understanding of a particular protocol area. I find that writing articles forces you to do further research to make sure you understand a concept. If there is anything missing in the EPF wiki that you think should be there, open up a PR or issue! And use the link that <@707841599287066647> shared for how you can contribute to an area you are interested in.
